title.narrative: MONITORING AND REPORTING ON CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: Major duty bearers, including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs, have the requisite capacity and accountability mechanism for monitoring and reporting on child rights, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Protection â€“ General, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys progressively utilise well governed and accountable child rights coordination and monitoring systems and have equitable access to justice, by 2021

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Major duty bearers, including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs, have the requisite capacity and accountability mechanism for monitoring and reporting on child rights

description.narrative: UNICEF works closely with the Government, Ombudsperson, Parliament and civil society organizations to strengthen their capacities in monitoring and reporting and to foster inter-sectoral cooperation to advance the rights of girls and boys, especially from marginalized groups. Steps taken by key stakeholders to implement recommendations from the 2018 independent evaluation of the child rights monitoring system in Montenegro have yielded some positive results but more efforts are needed. A five-year costed Strategy for Exercising Children's Rights was adopted by the Government which responds to recommendations from the 2018 Concluding Observations of the Committee on the Rights of the Child. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of additional analyses using MICS data available
Percentage of Ombudspersons` professionals working with children qualified to monitor the implementation of child rights related legal framework and practices and procedural safeguards for children
Permanent national human rights coordinating mechanism is in place

actual.value: 2019:The CO is working with Ombudsperson's Office, Council on Child Rights, line ministries and Parliament on strengthening the human rights coordinating mechanism for child rights monitoring.
